page.title: 16PENYFAI VILLAGE BRIDGEND
page.content: Most of the village of Penyfai belonged to the Court Coleman Estate. Colonel Llewellyn's family lived in Court Coleman House from 1837.In 1960 he sold the house and built a smaller one,White Hall,behind the church.The old manor house is now The Court Coleman Hotel.Penyfai Welsh Baptist Chapel was built in 1793 and is the oldest in Wales.When the Tavern was closed the Pheasant became the Village Pub.It was converted from a 15th century farm house.Behind the farm house was a quarry which provided stone for the village houses. All Saints Church was built of local stone and donated by R.W.Llewellyn in 1903.It is quite small.In 1899 Mr. Llewellyn built a church school,one room for juniors and one room for infants.In 1962 it was closed and a modern one opened.
